meanings.definition: To come together for a common purpose or cause.
meanings.sent1: The community will rally to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The team will rally before the big game.
meanings.sent3: Let's rally our friends for a fun picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her words rallied the group to take action.
meanings.sent5: The call to rally echoed through the town.

meanings.definition: To recover strength or spirits after a setback.
meanings.sent1: After feeling down, she managed to rally and keep going.
meanings.sent2: He needed to rally his energy for the final push.
meanings.sent3: Even after a tough day, she found a way to rally.
meanings.sent4: His determination to rally was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: With each setback, she found the strength to rally back.

meanings.definition: A gathering of people for a common purpose or cause.
meanings.sent1: The rally for peace drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent2: We attended a rally to support the environment.
meanings.sent3: The school rally was full of cheers and excitement.
meanings.sent4: The political rally was filled with passionate speeches.
meanings.sent5: The community rally united everyone for a good cause.

meanings.definition: A sudden increase in price or value in trading.
meanings.sent1: The stock market experienced a rally after the announcement.
meanings.sent2: Investors were excited about the sudden rally in prices.
meanings.sent3: The rally in gold prices caught many by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The cryptocurrency rally led to a surge in investments.
meanings.sent5: The rally in real estate values brought optimism to the market.
